channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: South Korea's President Yoon survives impeachment motion after ruling party boycotts vote
item.description: The motion, tabled by opposition politicians, needed the support of two-thirds of South Korea's 300-member National Assembly to pass.

item.title: Appeals court upholds law ordering China-based ByteDance to sell TikTok or face U.S. ban
item.description: Members of Congress had raised national security concerns about TikTok due to its ownership by ByteDance, which is based in China.

item.title: Payrolls increased 227,000 in November, more than expected; unemployment rate at 4.2%
item.description: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to rise 214,000 in November, according to the Dow Jones consensus forecast.

item.title: Nicole Kidman says this is the No. 1 reason she works so hard: 'I can create jobs for people'
item.description: The 57-year-old hasn't gone a year without appearing in a project since 2000.

item.title: I bought one of Sicily's famous $1 homes and spent $446K renovating it—take a look inside
item.description: Meredith Tabbone bought an abandoned house in Sicily for one euro and spent the next four years turning it into her dream home.

item.title: AI's growth is just getting started, BlackRock's thematic ETF head says
item.description: BlackRock's Jay Jacobs expects infrastructure and cybersecurity plays to shine in 2025. He cites the artificial intelligence boom as a major catalyst.

item.title: 'This was preventable’: Corporate world shudders at new risks after slaying of UnitedHealthcare CEO
item.description: Threats against corporations have been rising for years, fueled in part by the echo chamber of social media and an increasingly polarized political environment.

item.title: A 'hidden' travel hack saves money on flights — if travelers can pull it off
item.description: Skiplagging can save money, but flyers can have their flights and miles canceled. They won't be banned from flying for life though, says Skiplagged's CEO.

item.title: OPEC+ oil output delay a 'reality check’ as group eyes demand, U.S. outlook, Saudi energy min says
item.description: "It's not a good idea to bring volumes in the first quarter," Saudi Arabia's Abdulaziz bin Salman assessed, with reference to demand and global uncertainty.

item.title: UnitedHealthcare CEO killing spurs Centene to hold virtual meeting and insurers to pull exec photos
item.description: UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson was fatally shot on his way to an investor meeting by a masked gunman on a New York City street.

item.title: Brian Thompson killing: Police believe person of interest left New York
item.description: UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson was fatally shot Wednesday in midtown Manhattan. His company is one of the largest health insurers in the U.S.

item.title: I left Texas for Spain and have helped thousands of Americans move abroad: 'There’s never been a better time to make the leap'
item.description: "I wondered if it was too late to start over at 35, but I took the plunge," says the founder of She Hit Refresh, which helps U.S. women aged 30+ relocate.

item.title: Meet the industry insider who curates art for shows on Netflix and beyond
item.description: Yvonne Force Villareal is an arts entrepreneur who has licensed big-name work for shows like "Billions" and for real estate and public art projects.

item.title: UniCredit's Orcel could still sweeten his bid and take on a double M&A offensive
item.description: Divided between two takeover courtships, UniCredit's Andrea Orcel may need to decide between going big abroad or staying home.

item.title: ‘Pet sitter’ dominates the list of the most trendy roles for workers in Singapore, according to Indeed
item.description: Service and support roles are gaining interest among job seekers in Singapore, according to Indeed's 2024 Rising Jobs list.

item.title: India's central bank revises down economic growth forecast for 2025, keeps interest rate steady
item.description: The Reserve Bank of India has held interest rate steady since February last year, while a sharper-than-anticipated slowdown in India's growth has made RBI's task tougher.

item.title: Bitcoin falls below $100,000 after reaching the milestone level for the first time
item.description: Bitcoin had been widely expected to reach $100,000 since the U.S. presidential election but investors sent it to this mark much sooner than expected.

item.title: OPEC+ members to delay oil production increases
item.description: This production cut was previously due to start being phased out in December.

item.title: SpaceX faces opposition to Starlink expansion from Ukrainian group concerned about Musk ties to Russia
item.description: A Ukrainian-American group filed a petition with the FCC to try and keep Starlink from putting almost 22,500 satellites into orbit until further review.

item.title: France's political crisis just saw the government ousted — but Paris' problems have just begun
item.description: The end of Barnier's short-lived government is just the beginning of a new chapter in France's political and economic crisis.

item.title: South Korean President Yoon faces impeachment: How did we get here?
item.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol is facing impeachment by parliament after he declared martial law only to revoke it 6 hours later amid immense backlash.

item.title: MicroStrategy gives up big gain, turns negative despite bitcoin $100,000 milestone
item.description: Crypto-linked stocks gave up big gains even after bitcoin prices reached $100,000 for the first time ever.

item.title: Trump says venture capitalist David Sacks will be AI and crypto 'czar'
item.description: David Sacks spoke at the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee in July and hosted a fundraiser for Trump in San Francisco.

item.title: UnitedHealthcare CEO slaying suspect may have taken bus from Atlanta to New York
item.description: UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, whose company is the biggest private health insurance payer in the United States, was fatally shot in New York.

item.title: Lululemon stock jumps as international growth helps to offset slowing U.S. sales
item.description: Lululemon has been in a bit of a rough spot after the departure of its longtime Chief Product Officer Sun Choe.

item.title: Ed Sheeran announces concert in Bhutan — with tickets starting at $10
item.description: Ed Sheeran announced this week he's taking his Mathematics Tour to Bhutan on Jan. 24, 2025 — the first major international concert to be held in the country.

item.title: McKinsey unit will pay $123 million to settle claims it bribed South African officials
item.description: The scheme to bribe two South African state-controlled companies helped McKinsey and McKinsey Africa net approximately $85 million in profits, the DOJ said.

item.title: British regulators approve $19 billion Vodafone-Three mobile merger
item.description: British regulators said the tie-up can proceed if both companies sign "binding commitments to invest billions" to roll out a 5G network across the U.K.

item.title: 34-year-old early retiree spends less than $24,000 a year while traveling full time: 'I'm very happy'
item.description: Early retiree Purple has been globetrotting full time since retiring in 2020. Here's how she does it on less than $24,000 a year.

item.title: You only need one thing to ace an interactive AI interview, says CEO who makes them
item.description: Interviews conducted by AI are going to become a norm for job seekers, here's what one CEO whose company makes them says you should expect.
